required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of AT-1501 in Patients With IgA Nephropathy (IgAN)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2a, Multicenter, Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of AT-1501 in Patients With IgA Nephropathy

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase 2a, multicenter, open-label study designed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of AT-1501 in patients with biopsy proven IgAN and at least 0.75 g/24 hours of protein in their urine at the time of screening.

detailed_description.textblock: Phase 2a, multicenter, open-label study designed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of AT-1501 in patients with biopsy proven IgAN and at least 0.75 g/24 hours of protein in their urine at the time of Screening. Up to 42 eligible patients will receive one of 2 doses of AT-1501. All patients are scheduled to receive AT-1501 by intravenous infusion every 3 weeks for approximately 2 years.

primary_outcome.description: The change in 24-hour urine protein to creatinine ratio (UPCR) from baseline to 24 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Safety- Number of participants with treatment related adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 100 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of serious adverse events (SAEs), treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs), and AEs of special interest (AEoSI)

secondary_outcome.description: The change in eGFR slope from baseline to 96 weeks
The change in urine protein excretion over time
The percentage of participants who develop ADAs

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory- Change in baseline serum biomarkers
other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 100 weeks
other_outcome.description: The change in serum biomarkers from baseline to completion of study

arm_group.description: AT-1501 10mg/kg Arm A will receive 10 mg/kg of AT-1501 every 3 weeks for up to 93 weeks for a total of 32 infusions.
AT-1501 5mg/kg Arm B will receive 5 mg/kg of AT-1501 every 3 weeks for up to 93 weeks for a total of 32 infusions

intervention.description: AT-1501 monoclonal antibody targeting CD40L given as an IV infusion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male or female ≥ 18 years of age
2. Biopsy proven IgAN
3. Urine protein ≥ 0.75g/24 hours at Screening despite optimization with ACE inhibitors or angiotensin receptor blockers (ARB)
4. eGFR ≥ 45 mL/min per 1.73 m2 or eGFR < 45 mL/min per 1.73 m2 and ≥ 30 mL/min per 1.73 m2 with a kidney biopsy within 2 years of Screening showing < 50% tubulointerstitial fibrosis
5. Agree to comply with contraception requirements during and for 90 days after study completion.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Any secondary IgAN as defined by the investigator
2. Patients who have undergone a kidney transplant
3. Any history of kidney disease other than IgAN
4. Any history of diabetes (Type 1 or Type 2)
5. Seated blood pressure > 140 mmHg (systolic) or > 90 mmHg (diastolic) at the Screening Visit. Patients must be on a stable dose and regimen of an ACE inhibitor or ARB for at least 90 days
6. Pregnancy or breastfeeding.
